movie_title: Are you unhappy at work? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: We spend so much of our day working – how can we ensure our job doesn't make us miserable? It takes

vocabulary.definition: staying at work longer than usual or going to work when you're ill to show that you work hard
vocabulary.example: Many employees suffer from presenteeism, feeling obligated to work extra hours even when they are not productive.

vocabulary.definition: able to change or be changed easily according to the situation
vocabulary.example: Having a flexible work schedule allows employees to better manage their personal and professional lives.

vocabulary.definition: not willing to change or be changed; not flexible
vocabulary.example: The company's strict policies and inflexible working hours led to a high turnover rate among employees.

vocabulary.definition: a way of working where emphasis is put on achieving specific results or outcomes
vocabulary.example: The company shifted to an output-based approach, focusing on the quality of work produced rather than hours worked.

vocabulary.definition: a way of working where tasks are assigned and completion of those tasks determines when work can be finished
vocabulary.example: The project was managed using a task-based strategy, allowing team members to focus on completing specific tasks efficiently.

vocabulary.definition: able to be easily carried or moved, especially for being used in different places
vocabulary.example: The portable speaker allowed us to enjoy music outdoors during our picnic.
